706642f-a.title: Brooklyn: Schermerhorn Street - Hoyt Street
706642f-a.text:
Schermerhorn Street, north side, at Hoyt Street; Frederick Loeser's
garage on the N.W. corner.
May 29, 1929.
P.. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
706642f-a.folder: Schermerhorn Street & Hoyt Street, Brooklyn, NY

705001f-c.title: Brooklyn: Hoyt Street - Schermerhorn Street
705001f-c.text:
(1)
Hoyt Street, east side, from Schermerhorn to State Streets, Also
seen is 311-313 1d State Street, at the N.E. cerner of Hoyt Street.
May 25, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing the house which was built about 1874 by the Clark
family whose estate comprise surrounding area.
April 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, from a different angle.
April 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

706639f-a.text:

showing the Abraham \& Straus building in the background.

706640f-a.text:

706643f-b.title: Brooklyn: Schermerhorn Street - Hoyt Street
706643f-b.text:
211 to 225 (left to right) Schermerhorn Street, north
side, between Hoyt and Bond Streets, showing a group of old
houses in Brooklyn's business district.
View 2 is looking eastward and shows also the Frederick
LLoeser Department tore. Numbers 217-219 were rased.
View 1: May 29, 1929
View 2: April 7, 1932
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
706643f-b.folder: Schermerhorn Street & Hoyt Street, Brooklyn, NY
